Description: Shady Coral Tree is a medium size tree from South America, where it is a favorite tree for providing shade to coffee and cocoa plantation. It has large trifoliate leaves. The tree blooms with masses of orange-yellow flowers. In India it is occasionally planted as an ornamental tree.
Where: Near ISRO Colony, Someshwara Layout, Bangalore
Language Common: Shady Coral Tree, Mortel, Nourouc Sans
Name: Shady Coral Tree
Language Latin: Erythrina umbrosa, Corallodendron umbrosum, Chirocalyx umbrosus
